overview:
Jee In ‘Kay’ Kim is currently Co-founder and VC Equity Researcher (Games) at Syntasia, Inc. Prior to joining Syntasia, he was the Head of New Business Division at NCSoft.

Syntasia Incorporated is the #1 Korea social gaming company on the web. Syntasia was founded specifically to add a social element to casual online games because we love games, and we love them most when we’re playing with friends! Social games provide a more fun, competitive and contagious experience. Syntasia delivers on the promise of social networks, making it easy to connect with old friends and make new ones (no download, no install required!).

Jee In ‘Kay’ Kim is Previously, Head of New Business Division for NCSoft, the largest online gaming company in the world. Kay was Director of IGAWorks, Inc., one of the largest in-game ads media networks in S.Korea,China,Japan,US. In 2007, Fast Company honored Kay as one of the “100 Young Entrepreneurs to Game Industry Watch.” IGAWorks raises $2m in fundingâ€Ž Softbank Ventures and Premire Ventures Capirtal in May 2007.

Kay has over 10 years of founding management high tech startup experience, pioneering first generation products in areas such as In-Game Ads, mobile gaming, and online gaming, portal service(IGAWorks, NEXON, CJInternet, Daum Communications)in the United States and korea.

He is an angel investor in several S.Korea startups. He serves on the Board of Directors of Syntasia Incorporated, IGAWorks, Inc. a national non-profit that activates Korea’s top college graduates to help revive local economies through entrepreneurship.

Kay holds Ph.d, M.A. Graduate School of Communication & Arts, Global MBA(EMBA) School of Business from Yonsei University.

J.I. ‘Kay’ Kimâ€™s Specialties: Marketing analysis, Mergers and acquisition, Angel investor
